label: 大将軍
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: This title was held by Ōno Azumando, who was assisted by Ki Iimaro as Vice-General (Fuku-shōgun). Such a General (Shōgun) was at the head of a very large and powerful army, hence called the Great General. [大野東人、紀飯麻呂、副将軍、将軍]
